dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 6369 IH: To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to extend incentive payments for participation in eligible alternative payment models.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Schrier (for herself and Mr. Dunn of Florida) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, and in addition to the Committee on Ways and Means, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to extend incentive payments for participation in eligible alternative payment models.

section.header: Extending incentive payments for participation in eligible alternative payment models

subsection.text: Section 1833(z) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395l(z)) is amended—

clause.text: by striking In the case and inserting Subject to subparagraph (E), in the case;
by striking ending with 2025 and inserting ending with 2026; and
by inserting and 2026 after with respect to 2025; and

subparagraph.text: by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

With respect to an amount payable under subparagraph (A) for 2026 to an eligible professional who is a qualifying APM participant for such year, such amount shall be reduced, in the case such participant has received payment under such subparagraph—

clause.text: for at least 4 years but fewer than 7 years, by 34 percent; or
in the subparagraph heading, by striking 2025 and inserting 2026; and
in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking 2025 and inserting 2026;
in the subparagraph heading, by striking 2026 and inserting 2027; and
in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking 2026 and inserting 2027; and

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (D), by striking 2024, and 2025 and inserting 2024, 2025, and 2026; and

paragraph.text: in paragraph (4)(B), by striking 2025 and inserting 2025 and 2026.

subsection.text: Section 1848(q)(1)(C)(iii) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395w–4(q)(1)(C)(iii) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subclause (II), by striking 2025 and inserting 2026; and
in subclause (III), by striking 2026 and inserting 2027.
